biotools.summary: ActiveDriver is a computational method for identifying post-translational modification (PTM) sites (i.e., active sites) in proteins that are significantly mutated in cancer genomes. ActiveDriver provides signalling-related interpretation of single nucleotide variants (SNVs) identified in cancer genome sequencing.
